tests.title: should match valid modules with a single pattern
tests.fullTitle: patternToRE should match valid modules with a single pattern

tests.title: should match valid modules with multiple patterns
tests.fullTitle: patternToRE should match valid modules with multiple patterns

tests.title: should not match x to non-number
tests.fullTitle: patternToRE should not match x to non-number
tests.code:
const re = _1.patternToRE("x");
["A", "Z", "c", "#"].forEach((example) => isInvalidExample(re, example));

tests.title: should not match * to a substring composed of characters other than A-Z and 0-9
tests.fullTitle: patternToRE should not match * to a substring composed of characters other than A-Z and 0-9
tests.code:
const re = _1.patternToRE("*");
["c", "Ac", "cA", "0Ax", "x0A", "BA#", "#AB"].forEach((example) => isInvalidExample(re, example));

tests.title: should not match substrings
tests.fullTitle: patternToRE should not match substrings
tests.code:
const re = _1.patternToRE("A*xC");
["A1CZ", "AC1CZ", "ZA1C", "ZAC1C", "ZA1CZ", "ZAC1CZ"].forEach((example) => isInvalidExample(re, example));

tests.title: should assign all modules with *
tests.fullTitle: patternSatisfier should assign all modules with *
tests.code:
const { assign } = satisfiers_1.patternSatisfier(ref, "*");
isCorrectAssign(assign, modulesList1, modulesList1.map(([moduleStr]) => moduleStr));

tests.title: should assign only valid modules with pattern containing *
tests.fullTitle: patternSatisfier should assign only valid modules with pattern containing *
tests.code:
const { assign } = satisfiers_1.patternSatisfier(ref, "CS2*");
isCorrectAssign(assign, modulesList1, ["CS2100", "CS2040S", "CS2030"]);

tests.title: should assign only valid modules with pattern containing x
tests.fullTitle: patternSatisfier should assign only valid modules with pattern containing x
tests.code:
const { assign } = satisfiers_1.patternSatisfier(ref, "CS20xx");
isCorrectAssign(assign, modulesList1, ["CS2030"]);

tests.title: should assign only valid modules with pattern containing x and *
tests.fullTitle: patternSatisfier should assign only valid modules with pattern containing x and *
tests.code:
const { assign } = satisfiers_1.patternSatisfier(ref, "CS20xx*");
isCorrectAssign(assign, modulesList1, ["CS2040S", "CS2030"]);

tests.title: should not validate pattern with invalid characters
tests.fullTitle: patternSchema should not validate pattern with invalid characters
tests.code: ["AB123a", "Ac123a", "AB123^S", "AB1*3^S", "$A1*3^S", "/A1x33S"].forEach(isInvalidPattern)

tests.title: should assign only valid modules with pattern match rule containing no exclude patterns

tests.code:
const { assign } = satisfiers_1.patternMatchRuleSatisfier(ref, { pattern: "CS1xxx*" });
isCorrectAssign(assign, modulesList1, ["CS1231", "CS1231S"]);

tests.title: should not validate pattern match rule with non-string info

tests.code:
const message = "property 'info' should be a string";
isInvalidRule({ pattern: "CS2101", info: 42 }, { instancePath: "/info", message });

tests.title: should not validate and match rules with non-array property
tests.fullTitle: matchRuleSchema should not validate and match rules with non-array property
tests.code:
const message = "property 'and' should be an array of match rules";
isInvalidRule({ or: [{ and: {} }, { or: [{ and: 3 }] }] }, { instancePath: "/or/0/and", message }, { instancePath: "/or/1/or/0/and", message });

tests.title: should not validate or match rules with non-array property
tests.fullTitle: matchRuleSchema should not validate or match rules with non-array property
tests.code:
const message = "property 'or' should be an array of match rules";
isInvalidRule({ or: [{ or: {} }, { and: [{ or: 3 }] }] }, { instancePath: "/or/0/or", message }, { instancePath: "/or/1/and/0/or", message });
